repeat instruction instruction number do the instruction the specified number of times only needed for this project straight needles any size will do depending on your yarn thickness purple yarn green yarn sewing needle/crochet hook used for seaming pieces together and stuffing for this pattern i used 3 75mm knitting needles and dk yarn height of project - 18cm/width of project 16 5cm main body segments purple yarn make 10 row instruction additional comment number 1 cast on 10 leaving a long tail will help with the sewing/construction stage later 2 *p* 3 k2 kfb *k* m1 k2 this row is just two increases one at each end with a buffer of k2 from the edge feel free to change this if you want to 4-12 repeat row 2-3 4 this is just increases on each knit row until you have 20 stitches if you lose track of original credit cryptious on ravelry please don t republish elsewhere without my consent if found elsewhere this content should be free of charge times end on purl which row you re on just count how many stitches you currently have row 13 *k* 14 *p* 15 k2 ssk *k* k2t similar to row 3 except with decreases k2 16 *p* 17-30 repeat row 15-16 at the end of the decreases you should have 6 stitches remaining 7 times end on purl row 31 k1 ssk k2t k1 this should leave you with 4 stitches left drawstring cast off try and leave a similar length of yarn that you did for the cast-on tail as this will also be used during the construction leaves green yarn make 2 row instruction additional comment number 1 cast on 12 you don t have to leave a long tail for the cast-on as the cast-off tail will be used during seaming instead 2 *p* 3 *k* 4-17 repeat row 2-3 6 times 18 *p* 19 k2 ssk ssk k2t original credit cryptious on ravelry please don t republish elsewhere without my consent if found elsewhere this content should be free of charge k2t k2 drawstring cast off leave a sizeable tail for the cast-off as that will be used for seaming it together seam together with the leftover cast-off tail using mattress stitch once you ve finished seaming lightly pull on the tail you were sewing with to naturally create a curve in the leaf original credit cryptious on ravelry please don t republish elsewhere without my consent
